alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 2:37PM CST until February 27 at 3:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Wintry Mix of Precipitation Moving in Sunday Night... .A powerful storm system will bring widespread precipitation to the region Sunday night and Monday. Initially, temperatures will be in the 20s, with a wintry mix of freezing rain and snow north of where the rain occurs. The precipitation type will hinge on what the surface temperatures are and accumulations will depend on how long the temperatures remain below freezing. Winds will also increase from the east, thus impacts may be elevated due to trees and powerlines being coated with ice. Areas near and north of I94 have the greatest potential to see a quarter of an inch or more of ice accumulation. The precipitations will switch to rain, then snow with some light snow accumulations possible. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of two tenths to four tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
